website_summaries.verdict: One of the lightest inflatable sleeping pads you can buy for those needing a lightweight option.
pros: One of the lightest options available, coming in at 14.5 ounces in weight
Offers a valve for inflating and a separate valve for quick deflating
cons: Many customers had issues with the product staying inflated

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Inflates with a few breaths <10. Rolled on my side and my hip doesn't touch the ground. Little bubbles/air pockets allow air to pass under you and prevents sweating. Air pockets also slow the passage of air from one side to the other when you roll over, so the mat seems more stable than a typical air mattress. Packs into a tiny stuff sack. Great for backpacking. Has a double plug, so when deflating you open a second valve that allows the air to escape almost instantly.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Pattee

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat this pad without spending at least 3x to 5x more
customer_reviews.text: Just received this pad, and inflated it, then tested on my tile floor. I tried laying flat on it as well as on my side. at 245lbs i could not feel the floor in either position. It weighed in at exactly 14.5 oz. I rolled it up and was able to squeeze it down even smaller than it arrived. I was looking at other brands, and the one I really wanted was a slightly smaller pad, with a .4 higher R value....and it was $200 and weighed 1.5 oz more. This pad is an amazing deal and I will recommend it to anyone. The only thing i can see killing it is if it punctures too easily...
customer_reviews.author: v4lu3s

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it and already took over great sleeping pad for ...
customer_reviews.text: Kids love it and already took over great sleeping pad for use anywhere even on the kitchen floors keeps the kids of the cold tile floor while watching tv and also great to keep me off the floor when out camping love my sleeping pad definitely need a few more highly recomended
customer_reviews.author: Sarkis K.

customer_reviews.title: Super light, easy to inflate, and comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised. Considering it's size and weight it is very comfortable. I was able to inflate it with about 12 breaths and the valves work really well. Air does not come back out unless you release the second valve. It also deflates in two seconds, and rolls up quickly. The only drawback is I am not a small person ( 6 ft tall) so it is just large enough for me to fit comfortably. This will be great for backpacking. It is super light/packable, easy to inflate/deflate, and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: berto

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable - your body will touch the ground.
customer_reviews.text: I just got to use this in real life for a week back packing trip in Utah. The pad constantly lost air while I was sleeping. But even when inflated, my hips, shoulders and elbows touched the ground. I tossed and turned all night tryin g to get comfortable. My arms would fall asleep if i was on my side. I woke up every day feeling like my hips were bruised and back hurt. Im female and 130 pounds, so not heavy enought that this pad shouldnt support me. My partner bought a more expensive pad and slept like a rock. The return window closed one week prior to my trip.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Deflated on first use
customer_reviews.text: This product deflated while I slept on it the first time I used it. I verified that I had not closed the air hole incorrectly, and was super disappointed to find that this was such poor quality. Since there was some time between ordering the product and using it, now I am past the time that I can return it for a refund, which is also a bummer because now I'm out $40 and have to re-invest in another sleeping pad.
customer_reviews.author: Margo Ramaker

customer_reviews.title: Can’t hold air
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived. Blew it up let. Laid on it for 5 mins. Left it alone inflated for the night. Deflated in the morning. Blown up twice today and deflates in less than 4 hours while being left alone. Was going to use this while staying in hospital with a sick loved one. Too late to get another. Can’t be bothered to return. Stay away. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Donny

customer_reviews.title: Nice! EDIT: Scam not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Immediately inflated and laid on it outside. Was comfortable seems durable. For now:3 EDIT!!: First of all they offer you $20 for a 5 star review which I happily obliged before even using it because free money, however I never received that anyways. Then after taking it camping in Utah recently, we found it deflated the next morning everytime. Not a good quality product go for a better one And spend the extra few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air
customer_reviews.text: I had this for about a month and only used it indoors on carpet and it still got a leak somehow. Luckily it happened right before the return date. I really wanted to like this as it was comfortable and compact. The search continues for a good durable sleeping pad
customer_reviews.author: voltron512

customer_reviews.title: not again
customer_reviews.text: used it finally on a camping trip to utah and not impressed, deflated on me by morning the first night and same thing the second night
customer_reviews.author: Ero

customer_reviews.title: Popped. Thin material. Hard to open valve
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 70lb Daughter . Took her hiking twice and it popped. She was forced to sleep on the cold ground. Material is very thin. Also the inhale and exhale valve are extremely hard to open. My daughter or girlfriend were unable to open. I want a refund but I think it's too late
customer_reviews.author: OX_Man _71

customer_reviews.title: Good for big guys
customer_reviews.text: This is a very lightweight mattress. I am 6'4" 325 lbs and it keeps my body off the ground, even when on my side. I will be doing a lot of camping this year with scouts so I will keep you posted. The material does not seem very robust. I am skeptical of its durability, which is why I am giving it 4 stars. I will update once it has some miles on it. New update. Upgraded to five stars. Put it through a weekend of tent camping. Kept inflated the whole time. This is a quality product. I never touched the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S. OHIO

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable, deflates, thin material
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this about a year ago. While it is light, the material is uncomfortable and constantly slowly deflates. You have to blow it up several times a night to not be sleeping on the ground. During my last trip, it sprung a big leak and is completely ruined. There are many other pads out there for the same price that offer life time guarantees-- look at those products instead.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Small and light. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Mat has been almost perfect so far. I have used it three times and it is long enough and very comfortable. I'm 6-5 255 lb and ground out has not been a problem. The only problem I had was when I inflated it for the first time I let it set in our spare bedroom and in three days it was almost flat. I cleaned the area around the valves with hot soapy water and reinflated it. It sat for a week and did not go flat. Mat is very lightweight and much smaller than my old mat. I'm taking the pad to the bighorn mountains in Wyoming in a few weeks. I will update if any problems are found.
customer_reviews.author: Badger

customer_reviews.title: Very poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Got this pad back in March of last year (2018). I only used this pad on two camping trips. It now has 4 different pin hole leaks at different spots where the two sides of the pad are melded together. It seems the material doesn't hold up once those seams are under pressure from blowing up the pad. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lorax429

customer_reviews.title: Wish it worked better
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy sleeping in tents when using this. Just would not stayed aired up. I'm 280 6ft so not a lot of options out there and this one for me was bad.
customer_reviews.author: Smccoy

customer_reviews.title: What an uncomfortable waste of money.  Might as well sleep on tge fll
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap... You might as well be sleeping on the floor. No comfort ever.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Esposito

customer_reviews.title: Not good on their own. Work as extra cushion on a cot.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, easy to put away. I got these for my kids and myself for a campout. Not good on their own. They work for extra cushion on a cot but not by themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Karri

customer_reviews.title: Deflates systematically
customer_reviews.text: I had no problem inflating the mattresses and was very happy with the product and its size until I actually took them on a camping trip: the mats systematically deflate after a few minutes with no sign of puncture. Truly disappointed. Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Contant Louise

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Bother
customer_reviews.text: This only holds air for a couple of hours. It’s being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Schelin

customer_reviews.title: FAIL - spent the week on the ground
customer_reviews.text: Mat lost air half way thru the night, slept 6 days on the ground during a camping trip due to this mattress... DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Johannah Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Failed right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Tested on carpeted floor on the day of arrival and was completely deflated after 3 hours. Re-inflated and left alone and was again deflated after 6 hours. Not happy and really glad I didn’t discover the defect when out in the woods. Stick with brand names is the lesson here. I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air
customer_reviews.text: Leaked air out after a few hours of having it inflated. Tried contacting the company for a replacement hoping it was just an issue with the individual mattress I had received. Did not get a response so I returned it to Amazon, will be looking at other companies for an inflatable mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Anstine

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for normal/large size people
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold up. I was on the ground in no time. 200-215lb male. Will prob work nice for small people.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: you will wake up with the worst backpain ever
customer_reviews.text: this was the reason i couldn't camp after the first night on my 4 day bike trip rendering all my camping gear useless. I woke up with the worst back pain. I inflated it until it felt firm to my hands. But it was the worst night ever.
customer_reviews.author: Murad Afandiyev

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter for a 10 week trip and counted on all the good reviews to be the best one for her. Horrible! Flat and uncomfortable after first use. Worthless now and she has 10 weeks to sleep on a hard board.
customer_reviews.author: AET

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste you time and money on this product.
customer_reviews.text: I was really disappointed with this mat. It is paper thin and not at all as supportive as some of the reviews led me to believe. I almost never give a one star review, but this product is simply not what it is advertised to be. After taking it out of the bag and inflating it, I decided immediately to return it. It is way over priced. Could do as well purchasing a pool mat at walmart. I sent it back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Totally inadequate for anyone of mass
customer_reviews.text: Felt like I was sleeping on the ground!!! Provided no thermal protection from the cold ground and it slid all over the the floor of the tent!! Will hang on to in only because returning will cost as much as the pad itself. Will try in the summer with my hammock, but for camping in a tent...don't waste your money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim W.

customer_reviews.title: I HATE solicited reviews!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: 3 things I dislike about this product: 1. The inflation valve 2. The material is insanely slippery against my sleeping bag - on an inclined campsite I was slipping downwards all night. And also due to the material, it's very noisy. 3. The product comes with a pamphlet/card that SOLICITS 5* reviews for a reward!!!!!!!!!! This violated Amazon's terms and leads to inaccurate ratings. Totally unethical.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: This thing fills up fast, also goes flat with great ease when used in a real world situation.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfotable mat until it's flat 20 minutes later. Your on a backpacking trip and sleepin on the ground for 8 days
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't purchace again
customer_reviews.text: Hated this product, it doesn't fit inside the sleeping bag, causes you to slide to the sides and it deflates quickly. Bought this expecting it to be great based on the "amazing" reviews however the company indicates they'll refund you 20 dollars if you give a great review.
customer_reviews.author: Valeria

customer_reviews.title: Failed the very first time i tried to use it
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this air pad. I set camp on Saturday afternoon, inflated the air mattress and put my sleeping bag on it and had dinner. When I returned to the tent the pad was flat. I reinflated it and laid down on it. I could feel it deflating under me. Very disappointed with this out of the box failure.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I am highly disappointed by this product
customer_reviews.text: I am highly disappointed by this product, it was flat when I woke up both mornings and my back was killing me!!!!, it also does not stay in place the contour of the matt causes it to slip all over the place even on hard flat ground. I am only 5'8" inches and this matt is small, if your 10 years old its perfect, I inflated and let it sit over night, no weight and when I woke up the next morning it was not flat but a lot of air had been lost.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing more then a flimsy lightweight pool toy.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia S.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air - Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: The seams on the pad are very low quality. They are crooked, giving the whole pad a kind of janky, twisted shape and they leak air slowly all night, meaning you will wake up every hour or so laying on the cold hard ground. Definitely a Don't Buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold air overnight.
customer_reviews.text: Used once on soft ground and the pad no longer holds air overnight. Unfortunately it has been over a month since I have purchased it and my camping trip was this past weekend so I am unable to return.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge K.

customer_reviews.title: So light and TINY, but not warm.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a 5 night backpacking trip around Yosemite & then the Giant Sequoia NF. It was the perfect size in my pack. I think it was even smaller than my Nalgene. Super lightweight and easy to inflate. I'm 115lbs, 5'7" and it held me up well. Side sleeper too, it was awesome. Only complaint is that it's virtually 0 R-Value because it's so lightweight and thin. It got down to freezing at night and so did I! Thankfully I had a down sleeping bag, but man it got cold. I'll use this for sleeping in the SUV or summer camping.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: leaked immediately, unable to exchange :(
customer_reviews.text: Pad leaked air the very first time I used it. They offered me $20 gift card for a 5 star review! They refused to exchange my product despite providing proof of purchase and all necessary order info. $60 spent all for nothing
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on it
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of money on this little pad and two hours after sleeping on it it was flat it was like that from for the first two nights and finally I just threw it away it's junk
customer_reviews.author: Thane Eck

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. I needed a lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I needed a lightweight, compact, easy-to-carry sleeping pad to fit into my suitcase for an upcoming international trip. This sleeping pad meets my needs perfectly. It is small and compact and doesn't take up much room in my suitcase. It is easy to inflate - less than 10 breaths, depending on how firm you want it to be. Once inflated, I can either insert it inside my sleeping bag or place it outside the sleeping bag. It's also easy to deflate - just press the valve to release the air, and then fold it back to its compact form. Very easy to use and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Derick S.

customer_reviews.title: Not Inpressed
customer_reviews.text: Not happy😤 purchased this before West Coast Trail ( Vancouver Island) and it did not make it through my first night into Trasher Cove!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kraeling

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two to use during a 2 week camping trip but decided to test them out before taking them and I’m so glad we did! They popped IMMEDIATELY. They look nice but the plastic is so, so thin. Also, the packaging includes a promotional card to rate the item 5 stars in exchange for a $20 gift card to Amazon, but you’re supposed to go to a non-existent email address to claim the gift card. This is the worst product I’ve purchased on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save your time and go with another option
customer_reviews.text: Just no...save yourself the time and get something else. It's way too long to fit in a tent and cheaply made. We took one look at it and returned it
customer_reviews.author: Chelsi Zollner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Pros -Inflates with less than 10 breaths, maximum pressure is easy to attain -amazingly compact and lightweight -superior comfort over non-segmented type inflatable pads -if you're a side-sleeper you'll have fewer occurrences of your hip digging into the hard ground -Two-stage wide inflation/deflation valve is a great design feature and makes deflating the entire pad in less than 2-seconds -provides added and improved insulation -the segmented pattern is comfortable, stable and allows the pad to curve easier in small tents, or if you put the pad inside your sleeping bag to keep it from sliding around and add extra heat retention Cons -haven't found one yet
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and well made
customer_reviews.text: This pad is light weight, packs down to the size of a 20 ounce water bottle and is much more comfortable than my last pad that was thicker and heavier. My old pad was very noisy whenever I would move on it; this one is pretty quiet and I was never awakened when I shifted in my sleep. It takes less than 20 breaths for me to inflate and deflates quickly and easily. I'm 150lbs, a side sleeper and had no issues bottoming out on the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon4Me

customer_reviews.title: Works as promised
customer_reviews.text: I tested the the mat out last night on a hotel bed that was hard as the floor. It worked great! I like sleeping on my side and stomach so hard or firm beds don’t work for me. This was not as comfortable as my own bed of course but at least I was able to get some sleep. I didn’t wake up with the usual sore and aching shoulders and ribs from the hard beds. I will definitely be taking this with me on all my trips. It is compact and fits great in my suitcase. I have a portable pump that I borrowed from my air mattress at home and it inflated it within seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Bdavil01

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to pack, and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like to move a lot, and moving a bed is a pain. I admittedly sleep on this every night. You know, it is really comfortable, it can fit in small spaces, and it's super easy to pack and store. I also take it camping, and on mountain bike trips. I was surprised by how durable it is, I have jumped on it and it never let the air out, or did any damage. It is super easy to blow it up, it honestly only takes a few breaths. I would highly recommend this for outdoor enthusiasts, or people that want easy, small, light, or makeshift sleeping spaces.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Webb

customer_reviews.title: A revolution in sleeping pads. I should have gotten one of these right away.
customer_reviews.text: I can't get over the advances in sleeping pad tech since I bought my last pad. It's so small, so comfortable, so easy to deflate and roll back up, so lightweight... It didn't come with a patch kit like it said it did but I'm using it for in my hammock mostly and I am pretty gentle with my gear in general, so I'm hoping it will have a long life out in the wilderness with me. If you love to backpack or love having small, lightweight gear, and are still rocking your old giant sleeping pad, you need this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Psublime

customer_reviews.title: Mine was defective
customer_reviews.text: This inflatable pad had a leak in it right out of the box. I took it on a hiking trip in January in Ohio, so it was freezing cold. Because it deflated after a few minutes I ended up sleeping on the cold hard ground. Without an air cushion under you, the cold ground sucks the heat right out of your body. Not a good experience. I double-checked and reseated the air valves several times during the night, but that was not where the leak was.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M. Graves

customer_reviews.title: I liked my first time using this mat
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time to try and use a sleeping mat like this. I used it for camping, as most do I'm sure, and I slept as great as you can in a hot Texas night. Although the humidity and temperature were not ideal, the mat did help me stay comfy on the ground. I have back issues on and off and my back felt fine after sleeping on the mat, and to me that was the most important thing. I really like the mat and I will use it next time I camp or have a need to sleep on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: T Parker

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble and good for camping
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to assemble and then blow up. It took a solid 10 breaths or so to get it where I wanted it. It also deflates really easily and folds and rolls up nicely back into the bag. I bought this so that my sons could use it on camping trips with their school. They take the kids out once a year and each kid needs their own gear. This was a cost effective, small space consuming option. We tried it out in our living room when friends were visiting and it is definitely going to work for my boys' camping needs. It is not the most comfortable thing ever but it sure beats the hard ground.
customer_reviews.author: ColaCrock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hammock camping as a base layer to keep you warm.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this sleep pad inside my hammock instead of carrying a down underquilt. It is very lightweight and easy to inflate to your desired setting. I keep mine slightly under inflated which makes it stay exactly where I need it to be. I have had this out on 2 of my cold weather camping trips down to 30 degrees and plan to Carry it with me in my pack for other camping trips throughout the summer. I highly recommend it for anyone starting out with hammock camping and want to keep the (cold bottom) at bay. This air mattress will keep you warm down to 30 degrees. I’m very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DTD2112

customer_reviews.title: These were nice to have because the biggest compliant I got was ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these to take tent camping with the family. No one complained about sleeping on the ground with these! I was able to sleep on my side and not touch the ground. They are very small and compacted so they aren’t any trouble to take with you and they really don’t take much to blow up. These were nice to have because the biggest compliant I got was being sore from sleeping on the ground over night, everyone hips would be sore. So I’m glad I gave these a try. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to inflate, very lightweight and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad is surprisingly comfortable! We were looking for something to use around the house for our children and their friends. It works well for that, but also is big enough to easily fit my husband. It’s very small when deflated, and I inflated it with about 14 breaths in under a minute. We will also use this for my daughters when staying at their grandparents house and they need something to make the floor more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Purple Star

customer_reviews.title: Well made and durable
customer_reviews.text: After the first night, it felt as though the pad lost some air. This was expected. Every night after that, it maintains its firmness throughout the night. I am 6'2" and 215lbs, and have no issues with the support, even on my side. It is unlike an air mattress, which has a tendency to create pressure points. It packs away to just a bit bigger than a soda can. My 70lb golden retriever has stepped all over and slept on it when I wasn't watching. It is still holding up. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: jeremiah w pyrdol

customer_reviews.title: Not so great for those with larger hips
customer_reviews.text: Look, I’m a big hipped woman who carries all her weight in her butt. I know this. But when I first inflated this & laid on it, I could feel the ground under my butt. (To be quite fair, it’s the same with my existing sleeping pad so this is not an unusual issue for me.) I’m using the two of the together (the existing one goes in a pocket on my sleeping bag, and I’ll put this one in the interior of the bag) and together they are lovely. It does fold into a tiny small package (like the size of a large eggplant) which is nice but I found it took 20-25 breaths to inflate.
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer Broadbent

customer_reviews.title: Great product--for more than camping . . .
customer_reviews.text: I have fibro, so I'm sensitive. Yes. I am not a camper, but I bought this sleeping pad because after a hospitalization even some egg crate padding on my couch was not enough to allow me to lie on it comfortably. When I travel, I always stop at the nearest Target-type store to buy an egg crate for whatever bed I may be sleeping in. $$$ I thought this might be a great travel option that would prove much more economical. I love it! Can't wait to tuck it in the suitcase next time I'm flying somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: verser

customer_reviews.title: Saves my back while camping
customer_reviews.text: We go tent camping a lot and I really needed something to help my back while sleeping. This was perfect! It is very light weight, easy to blow up, fit in my sleeping bag just right. It was also easy to deflate and pack back up. I love the sleep I got while using this and I’m a pretty large gal. It is very durable, nice quality and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Keene Family

customer_reviews.title: Good backpacking sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a rainy week long backpacking trip. PROS: R value of 2.1. It was very light, kept me warm with it getting down into the low 40's. It was water resistant and dried fast. It wasnt noisy when i repositioned myself. Seemed to stay inflated during the night. Distributed my 220 pound weight well even while sometimes sleeping on my side. CONS: It took a few more breaths that i anticipated to blow it up. It has a pretty narrow width. It was somewhat challenging to open the valve to deflate it. I usually ended up using my teeth to pull it open.
customer_reviews.author: Thresia Mouritsen

customer_reviews.title: Where / How Do I Return???
customer_reviews.text: Was good for one hiking trip - on our second outing (1 week long) a hole developed at a seam and my husband ended up sleeping on the ground because it completely deflated.
customer_reviews.author: GarretsGirl

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I set this up twice it was actually quite easy to set up just like they say with all the other reviews I did not receive one that was defective I saw a couple reviews said that 1 of the I'm arms was backwards installed but I did not receive any malfunction 1 so I set it up I laid on it I even had my cousin who was heavier than me lay on it a header it seemed to hold up and her kid even jumped on it so I'm excited to take this on trip to Colorado and can't wait to use it
customer_reviews.author: Papillon

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money but....
customer_reviews.text: This product is a good value for the price. However I do not agree with some of the claims here. If you are a heavier individual you will feel the floor, I’m 228 lbs and do feel the hard surface below, is it better than nothing? Absolutely. My kids use these and for them yes it is perfect and they are not heavy enough to compress it. I do not regret this purchase and will continue to use the product Pros: good price, lightweight, pack able, solid construction, does provide a layer of insulation, very easy to set up, good for tall people Cons: probably not the best for 200+ lb individual Overall rating C-
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Won’t hold air
customer_reviews.text: Tried using this twice now and would not stay inflated either time.
customer_reviews.author: Doug D.

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't keep inflated.
customer_reviews.text: Took this product on a 5 day backpacking trip. Woke up the first to a deflated sleeping pad. Small leak on first time using this product.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ross Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and portable
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about purchasing this as I wasn't sure how comfortable it would be, and thought the price was a bit steep. I used this on a weekend camping trip and I have to say, I was pleasantly shocked. I ended up sleeping on top of a couple of sharp rocks/roots and couldn't even feel it. It was comfortable, held the air the entire weekend. On top of that, it was incredibly easy to deflate and wrap back up into the exact size it was before. The carrying case is nice and the entire thing is so light and compact. Game changer in the camping world!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad for the first week.
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping pad is lightweight, comfortable and quick to inflate. Everything you need after a long day hiking. We have converted everyone in the family to this sleeping pad. **UPDATE**The customer service on this product is AWESOME! James P. immediately fixed an issue we were having with one of the four sleeping pads we have . They are getting daily use for weeks at a time on an AT thru hike. Adding review: 4 of us hiked the AT. Inside 100 miles, 2 developed leaks that couldn't be fixed. I would not buy these again - especially for the AT.
customer_reviews.author: Whitcomb

customer_reviews.title: Great for the casual camper
customer_reviews.text: Came just in time for my camping trip. I had been using a thermal rest that just rolls up and takes up a ton of space (pretty much the size of a yoga mat) which is not ideal for camping. This sleeping pad is way better and fits in a backpack nicely. The picture is pretty accurate as far as size of the pad deflated and rolled up in the bag. I've slept on other pads that are twice the price of this one and I couldn't tell any difference. For how infrequently I camp I'm sure it will hold up fine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Shroka

customer_reviews.title: Excellent utility
customer_reviews.text: In cold weather or desert climates use either a Space Blanket or Mylar tarp underneath the pad. You will sleep better. Update June 2016: After a few weeks vacation, the side sleeping became irritable due to the pattern of the inflated mat. My siatic nerve was not happy getting up in the morning, HOWEVER, still far better than sleeping on the ground. I am deducting one star due to this. Other than that, retains the air pressure and I do not get cold because I have a space blanket that I use as my ground tarp. Without that, I can definately feel the cold ground laying on the mat alone.
customer_reviews.author: T. Vesper

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my ThermaRest for 20 years and it's still in mint condition, but I backpack ALOT and it's time to upgrade to a lighter weight, more compact alternative. I took a chance and ordered the Wellax before our 3-day wilderness adventure, and it didn't disappoint! The Wellax bed pad is lightweight, compact, and SUPER EASY to inflate and deflate for packing. Most importantly, it's comfortable. I didn't get cold, the temps were only in the low 40's, and it supported me sleeping on my back and fetal positions. If you are considering lightweight options, I love this bed pad! Happy adventuring!
customer_reviews.author: Morghan

customer_reviews.title: So comfy and light
customer_reviews.text: Gear is expensive. It was nice to get a high quality piece of gear at more than a reasonable price. Just finished a 3 day hike down into the Grand Canyon. This pad was perfect!! Lightweight, compact, comfortable and easy to inflate and deflate. The hike was pretty strenuous in certain parts and left us pretty exhausted at night. It took about 6-8 breaths to inflate and it was ready. The patter made it so I didnt feel like I was going to roll off of it and it was super comfy. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good pad for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: They stated in email they would call within 24 hours ...
customer_reviews.text: Update. From two stars to five stars. Chillax/WellaX not only contacted me via email they replaced the Ulira Air Sleeping Pad with another that has NO issues. I recommend this product because I used it 8/30/18 sleeping on my side with total comfort. Thank you Chillax and keep up your good work and attitude. The following two star and review was successfully attended to and solved. They stated in email they would call within 24 hours of my response to WellaX. Still waiting. As stated earlier leaks air. Inflated as directed again. May reevaluate if not contacted as they stated 24 hours. I want to give a favorable remark.
customer_reviews.author: "Tex"

customer_reviews.title: BEST PAD EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Hiked and camped regularly for four decades and this has to be the best pad at the best price I have ever used. After a few Sunday afternoon naps on the living room floor to try it out I had to take it out in the woods. Best ground sleep I have had in my experience ever. Packs up nice and small and 1.7oz is easy on my old back. The valve is easy to use and it takes about 8 breaths to fully inflate and seconds to deflate. I will be ordering a insulated version to try out below 35f.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Steffens

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service made up for an average product
customer_reviews.text: This is a conflicted review! Customer service was excellent in offering a replacement/refund or upgrade. The 1st sleeping pad deflated within minutes of inflating. Replacement with foam inserts is a better product, but an inexpensive product like theses can't be expected to compete with $250 sleeping pads. 2 Stars for the product and 5 for customer service. Brochure from the company enclosed with the product encourages a 5 star review for a $20 discount on next purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Much quieter than many others, very comfy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleep pad to replace another brand that I tried that was very slippery on the floor of my tent, and very noisy when I would move around on it. The slippery aspect of that one made me slip off it with my sleeping bag. This Wellax model's fabric is much less noisy and slippery, and should make for very comfortable sleeping on my upcoming backpacking trip. Speaking of that, this pad is very compact and lightweight, and will fit well anywhere in my pack while saving precious weight. It fully inflated in about 15 of my breaths. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Harris

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 did not stay inflated!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of them, used them both. One did not stay inflated! Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must for a comfortable sleep
customer_reviews.text: Everything was as described. It is extremely compact, took only 10 breaths to fully inflate, relatively thin but supportive, and is nearly silent. All of which were determining factors. When new, like with any inflatable pad, another re-inflation breath will be required after a night or two, a couple times until the pad stabilizes. A wonderful purchase and it made my sleep more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Last longer than my ex boyfriend....
customer_reviews.text: But that’s only for about 20 minutes. This thing deflated in less than 25 minutes. I ended up blow it back up three times during the night and finally gave up. Highly disappointed because of the other reviews. Don’t waste your money - just get something a little more money.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff Morg

customer_reviews.title: Great product, what a pleasant surprise!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical at first when purchasing this. However, it was extremely easy to inflate, maybe 7 or 8 breathes into it and it was fully inflated. It is extremely lightweight but feels very durable. However, I have not placed it on the ground outside yet though to see how it will last. I was also pleasantly surprised of how comfortable it was to lay down on and how it kept its support when you moved around. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Walkowiak

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpacking Pad!
customer_reviews.text: We went on a backpacking trip in upstate NY. Camped outside in the woods overnight. It was very comfortable! Set up was a breeze. If you got good lungs you could probably do it it 7-10 breaths. Not bad at all. Its also light weight and comes in a nice bag so you can bring it with you anywhere.I recommend putting it inside your sleeping bag with you because if you tend to move around at night, you may not be on top of the pad in the middle of the night. Great little pad!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Olson

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for a low cost
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable and easy to use pad. It blows up with only a few breaths, and provides for solid and conforming rest. My favorite part is that once the air is out it rolls up in a tiny bundle for storing. I am looking forward to many camping trips.By the way, I also appreciate the clearly written instructions provided with the pad that tell you how to take care of it so that you maximize its lifetime of use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Persell

customer_reviews.title: Deflates soon after laying on it
customer_reviews.text: So glad I tried this sleeping pad before bringing it on a camping trip. I tried it 3 times and each time to plug popped out within a few seconds of laying on it. I would not recommend and will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is suppose to
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other inflatable mats around the same price, this one works just as well. If you are sitting on this, you will bottom out, but if you are spread out, it does keep you off the ground...I am 6'4" 200lbs...... seems to be good quality...if you are looking for better support, you are going to have to spend more and buy a foam mat(i did and it is more comfortable but heavier and bulkier)
customer_reviews.author: eric gorecki

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad
customer_reviews.text: This pad is exactly as described- inflates with only a few breaths, is light, and comfortable. At 6' and 320lbs, this is long enough and supportive enough. I'm a side sleeper and even with my weight, my hip doesn't touch the hard ground. Obviously, time will tell about overall durability (I'm just the guy to put this to the ultimate test!) but at this price point and initial quality, I have high hopes!
customer_reviews.author: James fox

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and easy to inflate!
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping pad is everything the product write-up says. It is easy to inflate. My teenage son inflated it with about 9 or 10 breaths. An older person could probably do it with 7 or 8 but either way, it's under a minute. It holds the air well and is comfortable to lay on. I like the fact that it folds up so small and compact and weighs next to nothing. You can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Not for me....
customer_reviews.text: I just returned from a nine day motorcycle camping trip using this pad. Sorry, not impressed! It’s not thick enough to keep you from feeling the ground as you move around, especially if you sleep on your side like I do, and I only weigh 145 pounds! Also, it’s slippery, I slid off of it many times during the night. Will be looking for something else for the next trip... On the plus side, it is light, packs small, and is quiet. But, that’s not enough to offset the bigger issues I had with it.
customer_reviews.author: Austex7124

customer_reviews.title: Defective, sealed shut valve
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work, defective ...the valve is melted shut. Never could use it.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Works well, decent quality for price. Packs up nicely and quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I have spent several nights on this pad. The quality is decent for cost. It seems to have a slightly higher r value rating for its cost and weight, which is how I selected over many in same price and weight class. At first I found it easier to open the larger valve opening then pushing the smaller plug out. It's broke in a bit now however and not so difficult. Don’t depend on this mat alone for freezing ground or low temps, take a closed foam also. I love how this mat flattens completely and quickly every time I pack it up.
customer_reviews.author: Vantageshop-com

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! Compact, easy to inflate, and VERY comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how quickly and easily I was able to inflate this sleeping pad. It took WELL under 5 minutes to entirely inflate. It has not lost any air (I have kept it inflated for a few days and lay on it throughout the day to test it out). Is very comfortable whether I am laying down on my side, back, or stomach. The "waffle" pattern helps balance your body weight and maintain comfort. The pouch it comes in is amazingly compact. Just what I needed for my camping trip. I will be ordering more products through this company and have already told my camping buddy to order the same product for herself! 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Veronica A. Koebel

customer_reviews.title: The mattress was as comfortable as any I have slept on
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping pad was very light. Much lighter and compact than any air mattress I have used before. The mattress was as comfortable as any I have slept on. The air mattress was easy to blow up. It was even easier to deflate. You only have to open the valve and all the air comes out on it's own. It took me about a minute to deflate and pack up. That is much better than any air mattress I have had before.
customer_reviews.author: brian spencer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to inflate - really only a few breaths.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light sleeping pad that takes up less room than my thermarest pad. Stuffing this little guy back in the stuff sack takes some time so I just ripped the opening of the sack to make it wider/ easier to stuff the pad in the sack, and then I can still shut it with the draw cord. This little guy really inflates with only a few breaths. The instructions say you want to be careful where on the ground you put it and to watch out for sharp objects. I would definitely use a tarp underneath this if not sleeping in a tent. Overall I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tahoe pow chaser

customer_reviews.title: Forget foam pads or traditional pool lounger style inflatable pads and get one of these!
customer_reviews.text: This pad is small, light, and comfortable --EVEN on my SIDE! Inflation takes less than a minute. Maybe 10 to 15 good hard breaths. My only ding on the product is if you do not seat the one-way valve perfectly, it will pop out just as you finish inflating and you get to start all over again. Perhaps a second model of this will have a screw in valve instead of just push in. Other than this observation, everything is totally cool. I look forward to getting the most out of my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: my saving grace when camping
customer_reviews.text: lets put it this way, I stopped tent camping, cause I never got any decent sleep that changed thanks to two things the tentsile stingray tent and this mattress it took me 12 breaths to blow up. and about a minute to deflate and start rolling up the first night of the kayaking trip, I didnt use the mattress... and whatever side I was laying on, that was in contact with the tent floor, was cold the next two nights I used the mattress and it eliminated the cold spot from the tent floor and made it even more comfortable to sleep my bag didnt slide off of it and it was perfect highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: John C. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected !
customer_reviews.text: This pad is SUPER easy inflate and deflate. The valves are very good quality. The size and comfort level is perfect of me . I'm 5' 10" and 210 lbs. and did not touch the ground when on my back. As I said, deflating was super fast.and there was no problem at all getting the pad back in the bag. Very light weight and very easy to fit in my pack. One on the very few items that lives up to the hype and goes beyond. OUTSTANDING !
customer_reviews.author: Dan Knedel

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to your back country lineup that won't break the bank
customer_reviews.text: Excellent value for money, easy to inflate, comfortable sleep. This sleeping mat is comparable to name-brand counterparts at 3 or 4 times the price in terms of design, comfort, and weight. Although I have not punctured one yet (it comes with a small repair kit), it does seem more fragile than some of more expensive name-brand models that this is obviously based on. I haven't tried it in cold weather, but assume this is a 3-season sleeping mat. At about 1 lb. it's definitely competitive. If you're at the stage where the difference between 16 oz and 12 oz is a deal-breaker for you, you should probably just by the $200+ REI mat anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: I finally got a chance to use this last weekend. It was REALLY easy to inflate. It took somewhere between 5 and 10 breaths. I didn’t have to reinflate it at all the entire weekend. It was comfortable compared to others I’ve used. My only issue is that it didn’t fit in my sleeping bag, but that’s my fault for not knowing how big my bag was (bag was a gift). I need a slightly shorter version of this awesome sleeping pad.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Krussel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. I blew them up to sit overnight -- they were flat by morning. There wasn’t even weight on them. They were just sitting on floor. I thought maybe I didn’t close the valves properly, so I tried again, taking care that the valves were properly in place -- flat again. They are not the sleeping pads for me -- I don’t want to be 20 miles deep into the backcountry with anything I can’t rely on, so I am returning. I won’t be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: uberdenker

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Did not hold air - flat within a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie rubin

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Sleepingo
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this pad and the sleepingo pad for a camping road trip. The pads are very similar in design and I tried this WELLAX because I wanted something slightly larger than the Sleepingo. The problem with this pad (that the Sleepingo does better with) is that there is too much unfilled space between the air cells which makes this pad feel lumpy and causes your body to touch the ground in certain positions. Its decent for back and stomach sleeping, but the Sleepingo is more comfortable all around and offers better support especially if you're a side sleeper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping pad excellent for camping
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping pad excellent for camping. This came on time and as described. This is easy to store when not in use. Easy to take with you in a backpack or trip. This week great for kids of sleepovers. Easy to inflate. I’ve slept on the several times in the last two or three days and it’s excellent sleep quality. Lightweight. Great value. Very happy with this item and also we have a little company around the holidays it will be great for one of the kids asleep on as well.
customer_reviews.author: Love my deals

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: The pad was pretty comfortable. I can lay on my side and not feel the floor. I purchased this because my air mattresses always go flat after a few camping trips. I thought this might be a better option. I was disappointed how thin it actually is. It is much thinner then my air mattresses and felt like it would explode when I laid on it. The company is offering a $20 gift card for a review, so that’s a bonus. If it holds up well after several uses I would consider buying another one. I’m hoping that it will last longer then a few camping trips. Time will tell....
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

product_meta.title: WELLAX Ultralight Air Sleeping Pad - Inflatable Camping Mat for Backpacking, Traveling and Hiking Air Cell Design for Better Stability & Support - Best Sleeping Pad
feature_bullets: WELLAX COMFORT PLUS SLEEPING PAD provides the optimal Comfort and Warmth your body needs for getting a good night's rest. Your weight is supported by dozens of flexing air cells just like a pocket sprung mattress. Roll over or sleep on your side on a WellaX Camping Mat and you won't wobble or bottom out. NO MORE Back-pain or annoying Discomfort from rocky terrain or bumps underneath!

COMPACT and LIGHTWEIGHT: the ultralight WellaX Sleeping Mat has a single layer of Air Cells to give you the lightest (ONLY 14.5 Oz) and smallest packed-volume mat (10”x3.5”) without compromising comfort. The lighter your backpack, the more comfortable your hiking trips will be. Inflated size is 78” x24” x2.5”, perfect for any outdoor activity like backpacking, traveling or camping

REVOLUTIONARY DESIGN: Laminated 20D Rip-stop Nylon and the TPU Layer provides a good balance between low weight and durability. It is virtually silent, waterproof, abrasion / tear resistant and reflects back radiant heat to the sleeper. No more crinkly or squeaky noise, your perfect pad for using in your tent, in/under your sleeping bag, in your hammock, or any floor or hard surface

EASY TO INFLATE AND DEFLATE: Advanced inflation technology features 2 flat valves: 1 for inflation and 1 for deflation, making it quicker to inflate (only 7-9 breaths) or deflate. Say goodbye to your old sleeping pad that required either a pump or lots of breaths and effort to inflate. The PATENT PENDING WellaX Sleeping Pad has a R-value of 2.1, making it the perfect 3 season mat
NO RISK PURCHASE. Making you a happy customer is our main goal. Just try it, and if you don't absolutely Love it, send us a message and we will Refund or Replace your Purchase, NO QUESTIONS ASKED !
